subject: Parenting
title: Homework Helps Young Children Learn
description: One-minute skill: Homework Helps Young Children Learn.

hook.text: A first-grader cries over math worksheets at 7 PM. Is this actually helping her learn?

buildup.text: Most parents assume homework is essential for academic success at every age.

discovery.text: Research by Harris Cooper found homework shows zero academic benefit before middle school.

twist.text: For young children, homework often increases stress and decreases love of learning.

climax.text: Finland assigns virtually no homework before age 12 and consistently tops global education rankings.

punchline.text: More homework doesn't mean more learning â€” especially for little kids.

quiz.question: What did research find about homework for elementary school children?
options: No academic benefit before middle school
